column4: How can i find my windows partiton from my ubuntu? I really need help
hi kratz
Is mounting your windows partition all you need help with? (or do you have some other problems)
ok, lets start at the begging, whats the most important problem you have?
ok, so we'll solve those two things
What are you trying to compile with "make"
ping
sorry just read
ok, if you want to install programs in ubuntu
you shoudl first go system->administration->synaptic package manager
This lets you install ubuntu packages, that will work much better than if you compile them yourself
if you want to browse other computers o the network
You can choose places->network, wait a bit and they should appear (You may also have to look under windows servers)
ok so you do a search for wine
then you can click on the little icon and hit mark for installation
and then press apply on the toolbar, and it will intsall it
have you waited? (it takes a minute to come up)
installing the samba package might help (but it shoudl work)
right, you ahve to use wine from the command line
cd into the directory with the windows program you want
and run "wine program.exe"
be aware that unfortunately, wine doesnt run everything
